User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account within the ProblemPulse application, enabling secure access and identification.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

name.description: The full name or display name of the user.

email.description: The unique email address of the user, used for login.

role.description: The functional role of the user (e.g., Analyst, Senior Lead, Admin).

isAdmin.description: Flag indicating if the user has administrative privileges.

location.description: The primary geographical node or office the user is associated with.

bio.description: A short professional biography of the analyst.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user profile was last updated.

Problem.title: Problem
Problem.description: Represents a global risk or issue detected and monitored by the ProblemPulse system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Problem entity.

title.description: A concise title describing the problem or risk.

description.description: Detailed explanation of the problem, its context, and implications.

category.description: The thematic category the problem belongs to (expected values: Social, Environmental, Health, Education, Technology, Economy).

impact.description: Describes the potential effect or severity of the problem, often including quantitative data (e.g., '45M affected').

location.description: Geographical region or area affected by the problem (e.g., Amazon Basin, Europe, Africa).

status.description: The current urgency or state of the problem (expected values: critical, warning, normal).

trend.description: A series of numerical values representing the historical trend or progression of the problem over time.

tags.description: A list of keywords or labels associated with the problem for categorization and search (e.g., #Climate, #Cybersecurity).

createdBy.description: The UID of the user who created the problem report.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the problem entry was created.

definition.description: Stores individual user profile data. Authenticated users can list and get other profiles to facilitate node networking, but can only update their own.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique Firebase Authentication UID of the user.

definition.description: Stores global problem entries. All authenticated users can read documents in this collection. Write access is restricted to the creator.

params.name: problemId
params.description: The unique identifier for a specific problem entry.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure facilitates a collaborative risk monitoring environment. By allowing authenticated users to list the /users collection, we enable the 'Pulse Network' feature where analysts can identify and verify each other. Security is maintained by restricting write operations on user profiles to the owner (request.auth.uid == userId).
